newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigeria frees columnist after five days in jail.
newsitem.headline: Nigeria frees columnist after five days in jail.

text.p: The independent Nigerian newspaper Vanguard said on Friday that its political columnist Dele Sobowale had been freed after five days detention.
"He was released yesterday morning after spending five days in detention," the paper said in its Friday edition.
Sobowale said security men did not maltreat him but questioned him over a news analysis he wrote for the Vanguard, the report said.
The Vanguard, like most Lagos-based newspapers, is critical of the Nigerian military government.
Sobowale writes a weekly column in which he has criticised a new programme to restore democracy next year.
Another journalist, Godwin Agbroko, editor of Theweek magazine has been detained since last month and no reason has been given for the detention.
